chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey L Paul Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in FTE/schooling/combination of the two.  When not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service.
No contact with victim, B.T. unless authorized by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment or counseling deemed necessary by agent.  Complete AODA with follow through.  Complete SAFE intake program with follow through.  

DNA sample.

PLEA:
15CF1047:
Amended Ct. 1 Operate motor vehicle w/o owners consent >> GUILTY
Amended Ct. 3 Disorderly Conduct >> GUILTY
15CM1902:
Amended Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct >> GUILTY
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/ hold sentencing. 18 months probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: In 15CF1047 Ct. 1 & 15CM1902 Ct. 3: I/S 9 months MCJ. In 15CF1047 Ct. 3 & 15CM1902 Ct. 1: I/S 90 days MCJ. All jail to run concurrent to each other if revoked. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Complete SAFE intake program with follow through. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. No contact with victim in 15CF1047- B.T., unless authorized by agent. Pay back restitution of $1,085.33 at rate of $50.00 per month. If revoked, has 31 days credit.
